[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Maximum slice length] If try_from() receives an extremely large byte slice, could the try_into() conversion cause memory issues before the error is returned? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: diffie_hellman()] [Branch prediction attacks] Does the Diffie-Hellman implementation avoid secret-dependent branches that could leak information through branch prediction side-channels? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Trait: PartialEq for PrivateKey] [Timing leak in tests] Even though PartialEq is test-only, could the byte comparison self.to_bytes() == other.to_bytes() leak timing information that might influence test behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: public_key()] [Derivation timing] Does public key derivation from private key run in constant time, or could timing variations leak information about the private key bits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Serialization timing] Could the serialization of keys have timing variations based on key content that leak information to side-channel attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: generate()] [First-use RNG] If generate() is the first cryptographic operation called, could the RNG be in a poorly seeded state leading to weak keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Module imports] [Dependency initialization] Are the x25519_dalek and ed25519_dalek dependencies properly initialized before first use, or could uninitialized state cause issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Constant definitions] [Compile-time verification] Are the size constants (PRIVATE_KEY_SIZE, PUBLIC_KEY_SIZE, SHARED_SECRET_SIZE) verified at compile time to match library expectations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: diffie_hellman()] [Cache timing attacks] Could cache access patterns during scalar multiplication leak information about the private key to a co-located attacker on the same CPU? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: from_ed25519_private_bytes()] [Memory access patterns] Does the key expansion and copying process have uniform memory access patterns, or could variations leak key information through cache timing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/x25519.rs] [Function: public_key()] [Speculative execution] Could speculative execution attacks (Spectre/Meltdown) leak private key bits during public key derivation? (Medium)
